duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead a team of Systems Engineering Managers and support the Systems Engineers in driving growth within Commercial Accounts.
Oversee technical pre-sales operations and achieve revenue generation, individual, team, and organizational quotas.
Interact at a senior level with customers and partners, providing valuable insight into industry trends, challenges, and technical solutions.
Ensure effective account planning and deliver business-focused solutions that address customers' security needs.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with partners to improve sales productivity and lead portfolio expansion initiatives.
Report and make visible the successes and deficiencies of initiatives within the area.
Provide account support through SE assignments, load balancing, continuity, strategic planning, and problem resolution.
Operate effectively in a matrix manner with extended teams, such as Support, Finance, HR, and other relevant organizations.
Act as an escalation point for technical issues within the territory and manage successful evaluations.
Develop, mentor, manage, and support reporting sales engineers with technical and organizational leadership.
Ensure metric-based results are evident across all areas of focus and achieve personnel management and development targets.

education_certification.credential: A minimum combination of 8 years of first and/or second-line Systems Engineering management experience.
Industry knowledge of security product market trends and directional awareness of Palo Alto Network’s roadmap and technology development efforts.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Master's preferred)
